page.title: 15Shopping in a mining village
page.content: There are not many shops in Denaby.The biggest is a food{supermarket}built in 1960, and we have a general store that is open all hours.There is a{chemist,} a{post office,}electrical,a fishing tackle shop and a video rental shop.We have to go out of Denaby for things like doors,carpets,settees and other big things around the house.Anything else people need they have to go to another town.This means that money is taken away from our town without any being brought back in.When{customers} buy things from a shopkeeeper, that is his wages, but subsidized transport encourages people to go to other places to shop so jobs are lost. Our { {open market}is owned privately. On Fridays and Tuesday traders sell fruit, clothing,sea food,pictures, secondhand goods,meat household goods,vegetables,toys and footwear.
